Reviews.Title: “Great price for Venice, clean and safe”
Reviews.Author: fyllide
Reviews.Content: I read some of the comments left by other women and I am a bit surprised, so I decided to write a review as well. :) I am sorry if anyone had a bad experience, however I stayed in al Gobbo last year in May, when I was on a road-trip in Italy and everything was fine. Stopping in Venice was a last minute decision (I was on a motorbike and on my own) heading for Treviso. I speak Italian, so perhaps it makes things easier. I asked for an inexpensive, but a clean and a safe place and Al Gobbo had it all. It was recommended to me by a receptionist in a hotel that was more expensive. Depending on one's cultural background, Alessandro (the receptionist in al Gobbo) may seem a bit too friendly, which is pretty common for Italians, but my impression was that he was harmless. I concur he may suffer from Asperger's and it was noticeable right at the check-in. I also accepted his invitation for an aperitivo and dinner in the neighboring restaurant, because I wanted to return the favor for a good accommodation price. Everything was OK, he was friendly and polite and just curious about where I was from and why I was travelling on a motorbike alone. I didn't feel uncomfortable and I don't think that I look scary or aggressive. :)) So to sum it up, I'd recommend this place to couples on budget or solo travelers who are looking for a last minute place to stay in and who want to be close to the train station, Piazzale Roma or 15-min away from Rialto.

Reviews.Title: “cheap, clean, but the comments about Manager sadly true!”
Reviews.Author: JulieBWatfordUK
Reviews.Content: We were quitting a disappointing expensive hotel (Chiara) and this seemed ideal: central, cheap, spotless. Alessandro is rather 'effusive', and I wish i hadn't invited him to my room to check the TV, but he was easily pushed away. My female cousin and I had a single room each, and were very comfortable. We were fairly convinced Alessandro has Asberger's, rather than being really menacing, but if you're worried and not feisty, be warned. Breakfast was simple but ok, bread and jam, but for the price and position, it was fine. I'd use it again - but with my husband! Restaurant downstairs was good but expensive, and the waiter there took a persistent shine to my cousin! And we are 2 ladies in our fifties!! What a visit!

Reviews.Title: “ok...”
Reviews.Author: emillene
Reviews.Content: despite the weird manager it is very well located, the beds are just ok to sleep after a whole day walking...

Reviews.Title: “DOOOOOOOOON'T (specially women)”
Reviews.Author: Luna123123
Reviews.Content: I wish i had seen this reviews before, I stayed here because my trip to venice wasn't planed out well and by the time i got there everything was, either booked or too expensive. I found this hotel... got the room and left to see the city, by the time i got back to the hotel, the weird manager was trying HARD to get me to stay with him, he tried the kissing and touching thing. Sadly for me it was too late and couldn't leave, so I had to stay there (by the way, I was the only guest in the hote in a city that was fulll) and end up paying for a place where I couldn't sleep thinking the worst, and couldn't enjoy properly the beautifull Venice. It is not worth going through that for a good location. I do NOT recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, good location”
Reviews.Author: citygal825
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying here when our flight was cancelled due to the recent volcanic ash cloud fiasco. Alex couldn't have been more friendly, and knowing we were struggling for money, he reduced the room rate for us. Ok, so he is a little over the top, and I know some of you have said women shouldn't stay here alone, but to be honest, he paid more attention to my boyfriend than he did me! The guy means well though. The rooms were spacious, and the location makes it great value for money. I would definitiely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, humble but clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: poettony
Reviews.Content: Alex is a gem to deal with. Rooms are simple but clean and have private bath. They control the volume on the TV so it is kept low and hard to hear. Breakfast is VERY simple. Bring your own towel! Prices are fair, often with a discount if paid in cash. Have stayed here 3-4 times, don't mind it at all as I spend little time in my room. Safe location and VERY close to Sta. Lucia Train Station.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the receptionist”
Reviews.Author: asialarry
Reviews.Content: the hotel is not bad, it's cheap and it's close to the station. The problem is the receptionist, from the first time I saw him, I was scared, he tried to kiss me and then he keep asking me to go out with him....so bad...he's so ugly! Woman be careful, go there just with your boy or with some friends

Reviews.Title: “top budget hotel recommendation in venice”
Reviews.Author: olympustrip35advizor
Reviews.Content: superb find! two of us stayed here, last spring. â‚¬75 a night got us a very spacious room, with w/c; the first-floor window opened out on to a gorgeous piazza - with ornate church, fountain, and wonderful palazzos all around! the hotel is about a seven minute walk [leisurely, with luggage] from the bus station, and is very easy to find. the immediate locale is beautiful, and fascinating, in itself; it's about a fifteen minute walk to piazza san marco, from the hotel. vaporetti are in abundance; but venice is something of a micro-city, so walking it is easy - and Extremely fruitful for the senses. the staff are friendly; the manager, alex, is a good guy - flexible, and helpful [he let us borrow his own umbrella several times, during hellish downpours]; you could probably negotiate a simple, single room, for â‚¬35 a night, on a good day : ] there are also two charming and adorable dogs pottering about the place. but mostly sleeping : 1 only disappointment was the so-called 'breakfast' - which consisted of limp coffee, dry bread, and a selection of cheapo-condiments. this is the only area they could improve on. the kitchen/serving area was very pleasant, otherwise. there is a fabulous place, just down the road [over the bridge, after exiting left], which has stunning goodies for breakfast [and other occasions] at amAzingly low prices; unfortunately, we only noticed it on our last day there. this will Always be my first choice for a stay in venice. i'm going back there - for carnevale, 2010 - for a simply unbelievable price!

Reviews.Title: “Not for women staying by themselves”
Reviews.Author: BobBath
Reviews.Content: Strongly advice against women staying here by themselves. The male receptionist / son waited until everyone was out of the hotel before knocking on my door under the pretense of offering me a drink - persistently. I was aware I was the only one in the hotel at the time so proceeded downstairs to get him out of my room. He then suggested I go out on a boat with a friend of us. After he attempted several times to kiss me / touch me I managed to get away upstairs and pushed a chair against the door until I could pack to get away. Noone like this should every have customers. By the way age didn't stop him, I am 30 years older at least.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Popino21
Reviews.Content: Al Gobbo hotel is a very nice budget hotel. The rooms are big and clean. However, the doors are thick as paper so make sure you ask for a room upstairs not to have the noise from reception (with arrivals and departures at night, bell ringing every time a customer enters the hotel). The location is amazing, 10 min walk from the bus/train station and close to central Venice attractions. Ideal for people wanting a central hotel. The price was excellent considering the location and the rooms. Whereas certain hotel are charging twice the price for a slightly better quality. Will definitely come back at Al Gobbo for our next stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Basic”
Reviews.Author: swheels00
Reviews.Content: Al Gobbo was very cute. Close enough to the train station in Venice but not so close that it was noisy. Beautiful square just outside with fountain and church. lots of places for walking, shopping, eating and catching the vaporetto boats. an expensive area because of the tourist places, but venice is very expensive anyway. The staff was very nice, super helpful with information and making changes for you. The room was good, no TV and the world's hardest towels but a large bed and lots of space. A couple issues, the cleaning ladies in the morning a ridiculously loud- we never ever slept in. Also the breakfast is no breakfast at all. a hard bun, milk and coffee. After the first day, we went out for breakfast. other than that though, i would highly recommend it for a budget way to stay in venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, like home”
Reviews.Author: Crotalo
Reviews.Content: I and my girlfriend have just been in Venice, at Al gobbo hotel. It has been a good experience. The hotel is very nice, with a charming old age atmosphere, it looks like a '50es house. It's not a luxury hotel, but for a 1 star hotel is perfect: the rooms are clean, tidy and not too little. You can have room with toilet or not, but both are good, because the services are very clean. For breakfast you can have bread, jam or honey, coffe or tea and it is served in the kitchen of the hotel, as if you was in a private house. Actually, the hotel is also the owner house. Alessandro, the manager and the owner, is very kind and amusing, as the other two meber of the staff. The most important thing is the location: the hotel is 5 minutes walk from the railways station and from Piazzale Roma, the link between Venice and the mainland. I raccomand this hotel

HotelInfo.Name: Albergo al Gobbo
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio 312, 30121 Venice, Italy
